alert.note: Alert for Alger; Baraga; Dickinson; Gogebic; Houghton; Iron; Keweenaw; Marquette; Ontonagon; Southern Houghton (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 28 at 2:32PM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...Unsettled Wet and Wintry Weather through the weekend into early next week... A slow moving early spring storm system will bring multiple rounds of precipitation to the U.P. through this weekend into early next week. Precipitation will mainly be confined to the far western U.P. tonight before precipitation overspreads the west and central U.P. on Saturday. As colder air moves into the western U.P. late tonight, rain will mix with and perhaps change to snow resulting in some slushy accumulations especially across Gogebic and Ontonagon counties. Additional rounds of precipitation will occur Saturday night through early Tuesday. Total liquid precipitation amounts from tonight through Tuesday will be between one and three inches west of a Marquette to Iron Mountain line with locally higher amounts approaching four inches possible over Gogebic and Ontonagon counties. This will result in increased runoff and increased stream and river flows. The potential also exists for significant wet, heavy snowfall accumulations especially with snow that falls during nighttime hours Saturday night, Sunday night, and Monday night. The heavy wet snow will stick to trees and powerlines with isolated power outages possible. Travel will also be difficult at times as any snow that can accumulate on roadways will be difficult to move. Areas most likely to experience the heaviest snow include the higher terrain areas along the M28 corridor of the western U.P. and across Gogebic and Ontonagon counties. Continue to monitor forecasts through the weekend as travel and other impacts are likely.
